page.title: 02PETWORTH HOUSE
page.content: Petworth House is in the north_west part of Petworth.It was built by the sixth Duke of Somerset in 1688 and is now owned by the National Trust.The house is 312 feet long nd 50 feet wide.The biggest room is the carved room where they have a big problem because Gibbons wood carvings are crumbling away because of wood worm.Also the grand staircase ceiling ia threatened by repairs to the roof.The oldest sculpture they have got in the house was made in the fourth century before Christ and is called Aphrodite and is worth Â£1,000,000.There is a special room in the house which displays some of William Turner's paintings of the park.Lord Egremont lives in the south_end part of the house.
